ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] SoL
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah, I m quite disappointed that their specs don t seem to be very accurate.  I thought my machine was fairly high end, the weakest link (if you can call it
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah, I'm quite disappointed that their specs don't seem to be very
accurate. I thought my machine was fairly high end, the weakest link (if
you can call it that), being my GeForce 256 DDR video card.

I did turn off TnL during the testing last week...maybe now, with the "live"
EQ dll, I need to turn it back on?

Like I said, initial impression is distressing, however I have not ruled out
that I need to further tweak and experiment.

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Nygaardr, FC3 [mailto:nygaardr@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2001 12:30 PM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] SoL


Don't do it Jeff, heh. My friend here has a 1.5ghz, 256 megs of ram and
64mb Gforce2 card. He cant turn on all the new models and animations or EQ
wont load. Kind of sucks, you would think a computer like that would be
enough but its not if you want to see everything. Luckily I bought the same
computer Jeff did hopefully it will work.

Mu

-----Original Message-----
From: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2001 10:52 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] SoL


If their specs are accurate, you should have no trouble whatsoever with that
setup.

If you do, please send me your GeForce2, and half your RAM, and I'll be glad
to evaluate further. :)

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Nygaard, Jeff [mailto:jeff.nygaard@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2001 10:09 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] SoL


Ok, thanks a lot.

btw, I am running a brand new PC ( 1.7 P4, 512 RAM, 80 gig HD, GeForce 2
with 64mb ) with Windows XP, so Windows 95 is not the problem, I just need
the DirectX 8.1 and I should be good to go. With the above system of mine, I
wonder how much lag I'll have with SoL. Anyone have any other experiences
they would like to share? Will I be able to turn everything on and be able
to play?

Anyone else here run Windows XP? I was wondering if anyone else knew that
you can be running EQ and tab out of EQ and get to your desktop, check your
email or browse the web. We were killing WW dragons this past weekend and
Teenimu and I were tabbing out of EQ and checking that great web site that
lists all the WW dragons. The site lists what the dragon level, drops, if it
complete heals, what resists are needed cold, fire and magic. This can in
handy on which dragons to pull.





-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [SMTP:snicker@...]
Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2001 8:01 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Another issue...

There is no more support of Windows 95 or DirectX 8.0.

You will need to download and install DirectX 8.1

At 05:50 AM 12/5/2001 -0800, you wrote:
>So, which one is it? Do I need directx8.0 or directx8.1? I still do
not have
>SoL yet, but I should have it by weeks end, BUT I want to log onto
EQ to
>check and see if Dain has spawned in Icewell Keep. I've been
waiting for
>over a week now to see this short little sob and he has yet to show
his
>face. I need him to spawn to complete my 9th Coldain Ring quest. On
my way
>out to work this morning I was going to see if Dain was up, so I
tried to
>log in real fast, but I couldn't get the patch to start. I didn't
have any
>time to play EQ last night. Yesterday at work, I tore myself away
from my
>work and emailed to my home address DirectX8 and my newest sound
and video
>drivers. I just need to install them now.
>
>Ok, so now for my question, is the reason I couldn't log on this
morning
>because I have not downloaded DirectX yet? If so, which DirectX do
I need
>8.0 or 8.1?
>
>Thanks for the help! My gnome warrior thanks you also!
